comments.body:
Observations on related holding fields (866, 867, 868) of holdings where temp locations are in play.

1) All items on a holding are in a temp location.
    No holdings statement is included in the AVA field.

2) Some items on a holding are in a temp location, others are in the permanent location.
    A holdings statement is included in the AVA field for the permanent location, even though some items in the range (ex. vol. 1-v. 8) are not at that location. This is somewhat misleading for the user.
    No holdings statement is included in the AVA field for the temp location.

Unless a different approach is taken about displaying item-level information in the record show page, there doesn't seem to be much choice in following the above pattern. This would mean the following can be implemented for the show page:

A. "Location has" will be displayed for holdings where items don't exist at all.
B. "Location has" will be displayed for holdings where there are all items in the permanent location.
C. "Location has" will be displayed for holdings where there are some items in the permanent location [this will be inaccurate since the temp location items will be shelved separately, but it's how Alma returns it in the AVA field].
D. "Location has" will not be displayed for holdings with items with locations that differ from the permanent location.

The "location has" statement is returned in the AVA fields (AVA $t), but it could also be indexed from the publishing jobs (the 866, 867, 868 fields).

comments.body: @kelea99 the reindexing widget is pretty much completely broken. I added a little bit more to  https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/issues/1094 and will close this one as a duplicate.
doh! forgot about that ticket! sounds great. fwiw, it did end up getting all the right items into the collection, even though the error popped up and the numbers in the pop up are totes wrong.

comments.body: Image selection from the source is functional.  I can select a title from the pulldown, which does come up.  It saves. It displays in the dashboard as well as the browse page.

dpul.title: QA test spotlight features new in 3.0

comments.body: @kelea99 okay I think the features have all been QA tested so I will close this issue. It would be helpful to have separate issues for any problems you're still seeing with language functionality. If you could give example pages with "I expected to see X but I saw Y" type descriptions that would be helpful.

dpul.title: StartCanvas in SimpleResource JSON-LD causing Solr errors.

comments.body: I deployed the figgy fix and started another reindex of this collection.
it's in! https://dpul.princeton.edu/pudl0036/catalog/bv73c422q

dpul.title: Return a 404 when a resource is requested on a nonexistent exhibit
List widget is no longer showing bullets on front end view.
Back to top link needs discernible name
Adds text content to back to top anchor tag to make it accessible
alignment  for metadata in list view is not displaying consistently in all browsers.

comments.body: Reasoning for high priority to be done this work cycle: It should be consistent across platforms and as a list view it should be visually intuitive.  Especially considering the Milberg exhibitions and other exhibits also built in DPUL utiize the list view for items and an overview of the most important metadata/links to searches/etc...

The simplest solution to this misalignment would be to move the thumbnail inside of the column to the right of the title, below the bookmark checkbox. However, the use of ViewComponents seems to create some obstacles since the element classes are defined in ruby classes. Due to the actions loop and coupled wrapper defined in the method, it's not as simple as placing the "thumbnails" component into a layout.  

However, OrangeLight developers seem to have been able to position the thumbnail without overriding any ViewComponents (I would expect a "components" folder here): https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/tree/main/app 

Not quite sure how to move the thumbnail into the bookmark `<div>`.

Orangelight does it here in a view override for the index item partial https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/ace3e1ba6188b85a091eac310adb82b18ac1cfe2/app/views/catalog/_index_default.html.erb

Doing this with an override that doesn't use viewcomponents would be an option. Note this was Chris Beer's suggested upgrade path.

dpul.title: add automated accessibility testing to all pages
Exhibit item iframe doesn't have title attribute

comments.body: This seems important to fix, especially if screen readers rely on it for contents of the frame. @sdellis I defer to you, and others. What are your thoughts?

dpul.title: Enable embed widget for multi-volume work manifests

comments.body:
Tried this on staging and this fixes things on the indexing side. The embed widget itself could use some work for a MVW with many pages.

![Screen Shot 2021-11-10 at 2 33 40 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/784196/141189313-124149e4-baa5-4e4f-8207-35544a815061.png)

dpul.title: Embed widget broken for multi volume works

comments.body:
Not fine. The "item embed" widget does not work for MVW items. Example:

https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/317ae996-c459-4482-9d33-6571313a26d7

![Screen Shot 2021-11-09 at 4 21 45 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/784196/141015434-331c2129-2c7f-4968-b516-276ee9bd8d14.png)
![Screen Shot 2021-11-09 at 4 21 57 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/784196/141015439-75c84d93-5247-49f4-901a-3d29bd9101f3.png)

Guessing it has something to do with indexed MVW records:
https://github.com/projectblacklight/spotlight/blob/f1169e19631e2c79c88648ca310375634739e405/app/models/spotlight/resources/iiif_manifest.rb#L123
@eliotjordan, if it helps, MVW thumbnail selection did not work in the old DPUL either. I remember running into it when I first started learning about DPUL and selecting images for banners/etc...
Would be really great to get this to work, if we can. It opens up options for the growing number of MVWs in the collection.

Should you encounter any further errors, please do not hesitate to contact me. I am sorry again for all of this.
